Activity: Start the day with a strong cup of coffee and check emails. Prioritize vendor communications and internal updates.
Review the project scope document and refresh my understanding of the hospital's overall EHR collection and influenza trend analysis goals.
Prepare for an initial meeting with the EHR vendor to discuss the project kickoff and establish communication protocols. Review existing vendor contracts and service level agreements.

Meet with the EHR vendor (@EHRVendor) to kickoff the project, introduce stakeholders from both sides, and set the agenda for regular communication. Discuss project timelines and reporting expectations.
Document the key discussion points from the vendor kickoff meeting and disseminate the information to relevant internal stakeholders via email @ITPM-1, @ClinLead-1, @HIS-1, @HIS-2.
Lunch break! Catch up on the latest news and browse some tech blogs to stay updated with industry trends.
Schedule a meeting with @ClinLead-1 (Clinical Lead) and @HIS-1, @HIS-2 (Health Informatics Specialists) to gather detailed requirements for influenza data collection, reporting, and analysis.
Meet with @ClinLead-1, @HIS-1, @HIS-2 to gather comprehensive information on influenza data needs. Specifically discuss data elements, reporting formats, frequency, and any regulatory requirements.

Compile the information received from @ClinLead-1, @HIS-1, @HIS-2 into a structured document outlining the hospital's specific requirements for the EHR vendor. Clarify any ambiguities or inconsistencies with relevant stakeholders.

Send a follow-up email to @ClinLead-1, @HIS-1, @HIS-2 to confirm the accuracy and completeness of the documented requirements. Ensure all parties are aligned on the expectations before communicating them to the vendor.
